h1.span: YISD provides breakfast and lunch to go during closure

p.span: Beginning on Friday, April 24, 2020, children will be provided an additional meal for Saturday during Friday food distribution.

During the weeks of school closures, select Ysleta ISD schools will offer weekday breakfast and lunch meals for children 18 years of age and under on a drive through basis. Vehicles can pull up from 7:30 to 11:00 a.m. and receive BOTH breakfast and lunch meals for children.
The select campuses are: (click on school for location map)

br.a: REL Washington Elementary School, 3585 Lee Trevino
Tierra Del Sol Elementary School, 1832 Tommy Aaron

span.a: Bel Air High School, 731 N. Yarbrough
Hanks High School, 2001 N. Lee Trevino

p.span: Due to new state regulations, those who utilize the grab and go meal service at our 18 select sites to receive curbside delivery of breakfast and lunch for their children DO NOT need to have the children inside the car. However, they MUST provide one of the following items to receive school meals for children who are not present:

li.span: Official letter/email/electronic school application from school that lists child(ren) enrolled;
Attendance record from YISD Home Access Center, printed or electronic, that includes names of child(ren);
Birth certificate for child(ren) not in school; or

p.span:
Also, please keep in mind that each child is entitled to only ONE breakfast and ONE lunch meal per weekday; claiming multiple meals at multiple sites for the same child is not permitted.
We hope this helps ease any difficulties you may have experienced during the school closures, and we encourage everyone to stay safe and healthy at home. Thank you for your patience and understanding.
